titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Henry King papers, 1925-1962
titlestmt.author: Processed by D. Claudia Thompson

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by D. Claudia Thompson April, 2013

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: Production and publicity materials for many of the this director's motion pictures.

bioghist.head: Biography of Henry King
bioghist.p: Henry King was a pioneer in the American motion picture industry. He began his career as a film actor in 1912. He moved to California, where he began directing in 1915. His first major Hollywood success was “23 ½ Hours Leave” (1920). King made at least one film a year during the next forty years, working primarily for 20th Century Fox. His final film was “Tender Is the Night” (1961).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Henry King collection contains scripts and publicity materials for many of the motion pictures King directed, including “Romola”, “Jesse James”, “Carousel”, “Chicago”, “Prince of Foxes”, “Twelve O’clock High”, and “Tender Is the Night”. There are production stills and other photographs, as well as reviews of some of King’s motion pictures. There is also a musical score from “Carousel”.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Henry King at the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This material was received from Henry King in 1968

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was cataloged by D. Claudia Thompson in April 2013
